do you have the restricted driver enabled?
ok, so open a terminal and type "gksudo nvidia-settings"... make the chanes, apply, then "save to configuration file"
it should, as long asyou "save to configuration file"
yes, sudo is for CLI, if you're running GUI apps, you need gksudo
gksudo gedit /boot/grub/menu.lst    and put a # sign in front of the entries you don't want in your grub menu (i woudln't recommend deleting them)
what?.. commenting them out?..of course, its safe ignoring them to.. i just wouldn't recommend deleting them.
just put a # sign in front of the "Title" you don't want to appear, then save and exit.
in front of the title, yes
it should look like this... #Title Ubuntu bla bla bla.. .. then that title will not appear in your grub list
